reviewText:
There is no scenario! No goal! ONLY A LOT OF BUGS!

The game does not have any sounds AT ALL! I'm not joking! Only one ambient music in the main menu.
Also the main menu is terrible. Half of the buttons aren't working! Saving system isn't working too! The resolution and other settings are not saving. You cannot change the brightness. You can not change mouse sensitivity!
Also you need to exit the game completely in order to change something in the settings...and this is really annoying.

This parody on a game not worth 6$. Do not buy this!

reviewText:
Pros:  1) interestic artwork, although backgroundlandscape look like lazy work.
2) interesting story, although we only see the prologue

Cons:  1) terrible menu
2) glitchy menus
3) game seems early alpha stage in execution/tech demo/competitional or conference demo
4) total lack of progress
5) the lack of music/sound makes the game feel lifeless
6) The word short" in the description of this game

reviewText:
[NEW NEW INFORMATION] Re-first impression

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xhP3bLR7wAM

MUCH better than the initial release. Dreaming still only has it's prologue available right now, but the next chapter is on the way as I write this.

Overall the game's atmosphere helps enourage you to try to find out what's going on, though for now it's too short to really get you invested. I'm switching to a positive recommendation because of the significant improvement and responsiveness of the devs, though I still think perhaps waiting and keeping an eye out for now, just because of how short the available material is.

[END NEW NEW INFORMATION]

Blind First Impression Video; https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c2WoTcSAg1A

Follow up to my First Impressions: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yGZWnNQdIkc

[OLD NEW INFORMATION] The Devs have responded to complaints saying they will have a quick response to the issues, and believe they can quickly make the game more what they wanted on release. I personally suggest waiting, and not writing this game off just yet. [END OLD NEW INFORMATION]

Short version though: This should be early access at best, still in testing at worst. This game is missing pieces and seems to react randomly at times. It has a very mysterious asthetic, but it's difficult to move at times due to impossible obsticals caused by bugs, not puzzles.

reviewText:
I really wanted to recommend this game, but there is no reasons for me to do so.
I had expectation in this game to see how this game is inspired by thatgamecompany (Creator of Journey, Flower)

The reasons are as follow:
- Cannot even start the game, it just froze at the menu and must be killed by task manager in order to exit.
- Everytime I start the game, it switches my screen resolution automatically to 1280 * 800.

The music seems to be good (menu only), but it is useless when I can't even play.

Edit #1: VERY POOR customer support, does not response to the problems, one of the developers added me shortly after the review, I asked him about the troubleshooting and no response was made. You can even find this on Steam Forum, Do Not buy this game unless you have extra money to spend. If you bought it, you can consider using Steam Refund shortly after if you encounter problems same as mine.

reviewText:
ONCE ill Get to the MENU. Ill Tell About the gameplay.
i got this game from a giveaway, but it doesnt change nothing about the review.
i launched this game, i saw:
Thanks For Purchasing The Game!
i clicked continue, it was loading..
than it got out, Opened a new little screen , and the actual game started,
here is What HAPPEND:
+ i saw the custom cursor
+ i heared the music
- black screen for 5 minutes
after 5 minutes of Waiting. i FINALLY got to the menu!
i got to options, i wanted to set the graphics to ultra ( because my computer is good, and it was set on Low)
i setted on Ultra, the game froze, For 20 minutes.
i restarted the game, and BLACK SCREEN.
litrelly, 40 minutes i spent waiting for something to change
i seriously cant recommend this game, ill leave it for hour , lets see if something changes
now? i dont recommend it
